page.title: 16HEDGELAYING
page.content: WE MET ADRIAN BECKFORD WHO WAS A SKILLED HEDGELAYER.THE HEDGE STARTS AS BUSHES,BRAMBLES & SMALL TREES.THEY ARE CUT DOWN & BIG TREES & BUSHES ARE REMOVED.THEN FIRM STICKS ARE HAMMERED INTO THE MIDDLE OFF THE BUSH AND HAZELWOOD IS WEAVED IN & OUT OF THE STICKS.THE BRANCHES HAVE TO BE LAYED ALL IN ONE DIRECTION.THESE HEDGES WHEN MADE PROPERLY LAST UP TO 20-30 YEARS. HAZELWOOD IS USED BECAUSE IT IS VERY FLEXIBLE BUT IT IS DIFFICULT TO FIND IN OXFORDSHIRE.THE TERM USED FOR HOW MUCH A HEDGELAYER EXPECTS TO GET DONE IN A DAY IS A CHAIN;THAT MEANS 20 YARDS A DAY.IT IS A LONG AND SKILLED JOB WHICH NEEDS A LOT OF PATIENCE.HE IS WORRIED THAT MANY FARMERS ARE DESTROYING THEIR HEDGES TO MAKE MORE LAND. IT ALSO DESTROYS THE WILDLIFE AND THIS IS SOMETHING HE WILL NEVER KNOWINGLY DO.
